channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Acclaimed playwright Tom Stoppard dies at 88
item.description: Tom Stoppard is remembered as a playwright whose wit and curiosity reshaped modern theater.
item.content:encoded:
Arcadia, Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead and The Coast of Utopia. He's pictured above in London in 2017.'/>

Tom Stoppard is remembered as a playwright whose wit and curiosity reshaped modern theater.

(Image credit: Justin Tallis/WPA Pool)
item.dc:creator: Tom Vitale

item.title: 'Wait Wait' for November 29, 2025: With Not My Job guests Paul Giamatti, Laufey, and more!
item.description: On this week's show, we replay some of the segments we're most thankful for, including interviews with Paul Giamatti, Laufey, Ibtihaj Muhammad, and James Gunn!
item.content:encoded:
On this week's show, we replay some of the segments we're most thankful for, including interviews with Paul Giamatti, Laufey, Ibtihaj Muhammad, and James Gunn!

(Image credit: Presley Ann)

item.title: Why a revival of the 1998 musical 'Ragtime' resonates with audiences today
item.description: With its mix of Jewish immigrants, Black residents of Harlem, and privileged white characters, the Broadway show Ragtime is resonating strongly with audiences in the current political climate.
item.content:encoded: With its mix of Jewish immigrants, Black residents of Harlem, and privileged white characters, the Broadway show Ragtime is resonating strongly with audiences in the current political climate.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Lunden

item.title: This holiday season, consider nature's way of spreading its wealth
item.description: On Black Friday, we revisit Robin Wall Kimmerer's 2024 book, The Serviceberry. It argues that humans would be wise to learn from the circular economies of reciprocity and abundance in nature.
item.content:encoded: On Black Friday, we revisit Robin Wall Kimmerer's 2024 book, The Serviceberry. It argues that humans would be wise to learn from the circular economies of reciprocity and abundance in nature.

item.title: A 400-year-old kung fu-fighting monkey is finally having his American moment
item.description: The Monkey King, a rebellious 16th-century Chinese superhero, is finally breaking into the U.S. through Netflix films, blockbuster video games, and a sold-out San Francisco Opera production.
item.content:encoded:
The Monkey King. Like generations of kids in Asia, the tenor grew up in China obsessed with the superhero.'/>

The Monkey King, a rebellious 16th-century Chinese superhero, is finally breaking into the U.S. through Netflix films, blockbuster video games, and a sold-out San Francisco Opera production.

(Image credit: Cory Weaver)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: 'Left-Handed Girl' takes on quiet shame across generations in Taipei
item.description: Shih-Ching Tsou has collaborated with filmmaker Sean Baker for years. Tsou's solo directorial debut uses Taipei as its canvas to tell a story about women making ends meet in the city.
item.content:encoded:
Shih-Ching Tsou has collaborated with filmmaker Sean Baker for years. Tsou's solo directorial debut uses Taipei as its canvas to tell a story about women making ends meet in the city.

(Image credit: Left-Handed Girl Film Production Co.)
item.dc:creator: Teresa Xie

item.title: This expert watches shoppers like a hawk. Here's her holiday forecast
item.description: Retail expert Katie Thomas scours her local shopping mall in Pittsburgh to divine what Americans' shopping habits reveal about the economy and the nation's future.
item.content:encoded:
Retail expert Katie Thomas scours her local shopping mall in Pittsburgh to divine what Americans' shopping habits reveal about the economy and the nation's future.

(Image credit: Nate Smallwood)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: Marking 100 years of the Grand Ole Opry with Earl Scruggs and Loretta Lynn
item.description: We listen back to archival interviews with two Opry members: bluegrass musician Scruggs, who perfected three-finger banjo picking, and country star Lynn. Originally broadcast in 2012 and 2010.
item.content:encoded: We listen back to archival interviews with two Opry members: bluegrass musician Scruggs, who perfected three-finger banjo picking, and country star Lynn. Originally broadcast in 2012 and 2010.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: This new movie about Russia's independent journalists is harrowing, but not hopeless
item.description: My Undesirable Friends: Part I — Last Air in Moscow follows Russian journalists who report on the country's abuses. Reviewer Justin Chang calls it one of the most engrossing films he's seen all year.
item.content:encoded: My Undesirable Friends: Part I — Last Air in Moscow follows Russian journalists who report on the country's abuses. Reviewer Justin Chang calls it one of the most engrossing films he's seen all year.
item.dc:creator: Justin Chang

item.title: Here to Help: Thanksgiving Edition
item.description: From building homes to filling pantries to re-enacting medieval history for middle-schoolers – yes, you read that right – acts of volunteerism have remained vital for communities across the country.
item.content:encoded: From building homes to filling pantries to re-enacting medieval history for middle-schoolers – yes, you read that right – acts of volunteerism have remained vital for communities across the country.
item.dc:creator: Matt Ozug
